title: Deathsworn Katarina is a P2W skin
body: It's ridiculous how quiet her ult sound is compared to her base/other skins. Riot says they are committed to making skin gameplay easy to read and consistent (hence lancer blitz walk animation), so how did this get through???

replies.body: Funny story, in playtesting we gave the feedback that her ult sound was wayyyy too loud. I haven't seen it on live yet so I'm not sure how it was adjusted but sorry if it really is quiet!

:O  Maybe it's just me, I don't know. I'm so used to hearing the iconic cling-clang sound of her ult, so it being so soundless really surprised me. The audio cue is really important in my opinion. Not having the audio cue means you have to rely solely on visual cues/tracking Kat in teamfights, which gives her a direct in-game benefit.

Honestly.... I've had times where Eve's quiet Demon mode really challenges my multitasking... All the OTHER sounds on the map get stifled, which kind of makes you wonder how serious some of your team's skirmishes are, or how close the fight is to her invisibility.

Did you ever test Death Sworn Katarina on Twisted Treeline?

She's really hard to see until she acquires miscellaneous buffs ie Elixir of Sorcery and maybe the Alter buffs

I really don't like the trend of "no character inking" on specific champions/skins (if that's what it is - because that's definitely what it looks like)

Lol like elementalis lux the e and ults on certains maps using air,ice,mystic I can't see anything low graphics, invisible man.
Skins get wins, slightly more advantages to terrain if their abilities and themselves blend in.

A little bit off topic but Death Sworn Viktors Q and E (Q moreso) are too quiet as well, it makes the skin feel really puny and weak. 

Also the Q seems really slow too and not smooth.
The SFX are going to be fixed next patch. Also, not hearing the sounds on her abilities does not make the skin pay to win. Her visuals are more than a clear indicator.
Not in the middle of a teamfight with multiple AoE abilities going off at the same time.

Do you even Star Guardian Ahri, OP?

You can't hear her Q until it hits something.
It's way worse with Kat though; even a 0.5 second delay in cc'ing her could make or break a teamfight with how much of her power budget is in her ult.

Ult? Pffft.

Picking up 3 daggers equals ult's damage, except with a reset you can do that in a second instead of 2.5.

First time I played against it. She barely makes any sound at all, especially when ulting.

Riot please, fix this. As it stands, it's a fine example of a pay2win skin.

It's really funny because a lot of skins actually add MORE visual or audial clarity than the base skin. A lot of Lux skin lasers are more accurate to its hitbox, Challenger Nidalee spears are much brighter and easier to read than the base version, and SG Ahri ult has a huge amount of visual cues going on than any of her other skins.

To be honest, many kat players liked the skin because the abilities feel smooth because of the sounds being smoother. I'd say she needs just a little bit of a louder ult, just a little and it will be perfect, however that doesn't make it a P2W skin. There is a literally giant red circle that appears around her meaning she is ulting, and the animation of how that circle appears is very visible. I also would relate her ult to fapping sounds ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°){{champion:55}}
It's difficult to see the Skt t1 Red Zac Blobs in a pile of minions during a team fight
I have a similar problem with DS Zed's ult.
it's not about the skin. Try the classic ones or the other skins. It's a bug, they all have the same problem.

they are doing it next patch, the reason why the sound went in live softer is because they were changing it right before the cut of changes when the patch went out. it will be back to the regular sound

a lot of skins have this function

most people are used to vlad being red

when he's using soul stealer skin, he has a tiny, but noticable advantage in prolonged encounters where most people are not used to a green guy doing vlad things because it breaks the psychological imprint they have on him

Then there are counter examples like snow singed. His vanilla skin emits green poison which kind of blends in the background and may cause people to take extra damage than they normally would, but snow singed has white particles that clearly stand out and warn people away from his trail of poison
